The color of materials can be aﬀected by a combination of
factors, such as particle size, packing density, crystal structure,
and chemical composition. As the particle size of the pigment
decreases, the color tends to be brighter or lighter.
, there was no diﬀerence in the particle size of
and 0.04). Therefore, the color of these pigments depends on
the crystal system. In contrast, the particle size of

pigment was also evaluated. The powder
sample was dispersed into 4% acetic acid and 4% ammonium
bicarbonate aqueous solutions. After leaving them at room
temperature for 6 h, the samples were washed with deionized
water and ethanol and then dried at room temperature. The
color of the samples after the chemical stability test was
evaluated using the colorimeter. Unfortunately, slight color
degradation was observed after the soaking test, as summarized
, so it is necessary to cover the surface using an inert
substance such as silica to suppress the color degradation.
